intro: Hexactina, commonly known as the sea holly, is a type of marine plant found in coastal regions. It belongs to the family Echinochromeaceae and is characterized by its unique, spiny structures. The plant thrives in intertidal zones and is adapted to withstand harsh ocean conditions. Its morphology includes a central stem with radiating branches, giving it a star-like appearance. Hexactina plays a role in marine ecosystems by providing habitat for small aquatic organisms.
